snippet: The Obama White House has worked to change the subject to social issues. But in a pocketbook election, it helps to focus on pocketbook anxieties.
abstract: Ross Douthat Op-Ed column asserts that the Obama White House has consistently tried to shift the focus of debate from the economy to social issues; contends that while the strategy has been successful at winning news cycles, it is doing little to sway voters' preferences.
lead_paragraph: The Obama White House has worked to change the subject to social issues. But in a pocketbook election, it helps to focus on pocketbook anxieties.

headline.print_headline: Winning the News Cycle, Losing the Race
headline.seo: Winning the News Cycle, Losing the Race
headline.main: Winning the News Cycle, Losing the Race

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Same-Sex Marriage, Civil Unions and Domestic Partnerships
